answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for posting.White matter disease or lesions in the white matter of brain can occur due to various causes like chronic headache, migraines, stroke, TIA or transient ischemic attacks, diabetes, high BP, brain infections like encephalitis, MS and dementia.In your son’s case chronic headache or migraine seems to be the most likely cause because he has a positive history of the same.This of course needs to be confirmed by a neurological exam please go ahead and get your son’s neurological exam done and let us know if you have any more questions.

question: My 10 year old son has been seen for the last 2 1/2 years for headaches usually occurring 1-3 times a week. He recently had an MRI done and was diagnosed with white matter disease and we are being referred to a neurologist.  Does anyone have any information as to what this could mean.  The internet has a very long list of diseases that could cause this but he does not have any other symptoms.
title: Headaches and white matter disease
